<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module5_mcq_q57')" data-correct-answer="C">
<strong style="display: block;">Using Fama-French factors: Rf = 0.5% per month. For a stock, βm=1.0, βSMB=0.3, βHML=0.2. E[Rm−Rf]=0.6%, E[RSMB]=0.4%, E[RHML]=0.3%. What is its expected monthly return?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q57" value="A"> A. 1.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q57" value="B"> B. 1.1%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q57" value="C"> C. 1.2%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q57" value="D"> D. 1.3%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q57" value="E"> E. 1.4%</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module5_mcq_q57" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: C. E[R] = Rf + βm×0.6 + βSMB×0.4 + βHML×0.3 = 0.5 + 0.6 + 0.12 + 0.06 = 1.28% ≈ 1.3%.
